mods.note: Repeated Saving to Jerusalem Beirut No.16 Bagdad No.25 Tehran No. 30 _ , , Government of India $**+*+* 7m 1 Nairobi 1 X X X X M.Strassburger Polidi Minister of Finance in General^ Sikorskiâ€™s Government, is leaving shortly for the Middle mast to take up his new post as Polish Minister of State there. I understand that his authority extends also to Polish all airs in India and East Africa. 2. I said that I would let you know that he was coming and ask the British authorities in the Middle East to extend to him all the usual courtesies and facilities. 5. Strassburger is an intelligent and reasonable man having experience of business life as well as of politics and diplomacy; he is sincerely inclined to moderation in his views but cannot be trusted always to maintain them at the risk of losing his position. His English is passable. [Copies sent to Mr.Armstrong].Cover for Enclosures in Weekly Letter No. P.Z. dated from Secretary, Political and Secret Department (External), India Office, to Foreign Secretary, Foreign and Political Depart ment, Government of India.

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Ext 5076/43 'Polish Minister of State: Middle East'

physicalDescription.extent: Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 3; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file contains a letter from the Foreign Office to the Minister of State, Cairo, regarding Henryk Leon Strasburger, the newly appointed Minister in the Middle East for the Polish Government-in-Exile.
